result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/2019.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
fine set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two in 14CF839; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for six days 3/3/2014 to 3/8/2014 time served.

Provide a DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one in 14CF839; and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for six days, 3/3/2014-3/8/2014.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  To be served in Wisconsin State Prison System.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryson Tyreese Tompkins

records.addlTxt: Per order dated January 30, 2018, Appeal No. 2017XX28-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Tompkins to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to February 9, 2018.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in custody.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction (incarceration to be served is Wisconsin State Prison System) concurrent with count 2 in 14CF839 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 6 days (3-3-2014 to 3-8-2014) time served. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction (incarceration to be served is Wisconsin State Prison System) concurrent with count 1 in 14CF839 and consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 6 days (3-3-2014 to 3-8-2014) time served. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later 12-31-2019; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

AS TO COUNT 1 and AMENDED COUNT 2 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody, pending sentencing hearing on 11-16-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Court vacated jury trial on 11-16-2015.  

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, branch 17. FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.

AS TO COUNT 2:   On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.341(3g)(3),  a misdemeanor.

Case proceeded to plea hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Paul Marchan in court, defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins not in court, in custody not produced.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Held off the record.
Defendant is currently in custody in Waukesha County on other charges.  Joint request for adjourned final pretrial conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference on 11/10/15 at 1:30 pm in Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 8-31-15.
Bench warrant in file.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for INTENSIVE Supervision.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. 

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. 

No possession of firearms, ammunition, magazines, holsters, or body armor.

Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in custody.  
Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter for the Court for Return on warrant.  Hearing proceeded.  Bail arguments made by defense and the state.  The Court orders bail in the amount of $7500.00 CASH with turn over to JusticePoint for Intensive Supervision.  Defense newly appointed to this case and awaiting discovery materials from prior counsel.  The Court set this matter for jury trial.  The Court sets the following deadlines: 1) if defense has not received discovery from prior counsel defense to notify the state by 9-4-15; state to turn over discovery materials by 9-11-15 (if requested); any motions to be filed on or before 9-21-15.  Motions MUST be filed in Branch 17; hearing to be set upon filing.  The state turns over partial discovery materials in open court.  Filed, Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Order to Produce for Return on Warrant on September 1, 2015 @ 1:30pm received and filed.
Defense Counsel notified Court Defendant is in custody. Case set for Return on Warrant on 09-01-2015 at 1:30pm. Defense counsel to bring verification of custody status.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions, State's Motion in Limine, and Amended Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Final Pretrial. Defendant not present in Court. Due to the Defendant's non appearnace, Court orders the bench warrant to remain.
Jury Trial scheduled for 3-4-2015 is vacated.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated February 5, 2015, received and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Case in court due to violation. Report received 1-27-2015, Defendant absconded Justice Point 1-26-2015 before case being addressed by Court.  Court forfeits cash bail. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial on 2-11-2015 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 3-4-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.

12-19-2014

Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 2-11-2015 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 3-4-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Enhanced Supervision.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

State and Defense address bail. Court sets cash bail. 
Defense requests case be set for Scheduling Conference. Case is adjourned for Scheduing Conference on 12-22-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Court vacates the Jury Trial scheduled for 10-1-2014.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel of Record, Motion in Limine, and Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. For the reasons that were placed on the record Court orders case adjourned for Final Pretrial on 9-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

filed and received.

All previous ordered terms and conditions to remain.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense addresses the Bail/Bond Hearing. Arguments heard. Court orders pursuant to Judge Pocan's order on July 25, 2014, the $750.00 signature be reinstated. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Pretrial scheduling order filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Br. 17. Any Motions to be filed by 8/25/2014.  Calendar call scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 05:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins not in court, in custody and not produced. Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Case set for bail-bond hearing. For reasons stated on the record, defendant to provide documentation to the Court at next scheduled hearing and bail to be addressed. Court ordered that bail and conditions are to remain the same. All parties are notified that effective 8-03-14 this case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17, in Room 313 of the Safety Building. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference/Bail-bond hearing, Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served; original in court.  Case set for bail/bond review on 7-24-14, 8:30.  Attorney Taylor notified by voice message; ADA's office notified via e-mail.  alp

  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant not produced from Waukesha County Jail for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 26. Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 03-18-2014 received and filed. (14 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  ASSISTANT STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER VALERIA TAYLOR, 819 N 6th Street, 9th Flr., Milwaukee, WI  53202

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Hearing is sequestered.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding Waukesha County case #09CF1352 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Robinson-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.
DEFENDANT HAS REQUESTED ON THE RECORD A SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND, DEFENDANT IS IN CUSTODY ON A HOLD FROM ANOTHER JURISDICTION.  DEFENSE COUNSEL HAS REQUESTED THAT THE DEFENDANT BE PRODUCED FOR ALL PROCEEDINGS BEFORE THE TRIAL COURT.

Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Bryson Tyreese Tompkins in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
